Patna.special: Capital city; ancient Pataliputra; Mahatma Gandhi Setu; major educational hub (IIT, NIT, Patna University); Ganga river; Birthplace of Guru Gobind Singh.
Patna.famous: Golghar, Kumhrar ruins, Takht Sri Harmandir Sahib, Patna Museum.

Nalanda.special: Ancient Nalanda University (UNESCO World Heritage); Ruins of Nalanda Mahavihara; Buddhist Circuit.
Nalanda.famous: Rajgir, International Buddhist Conference, hot springs.

Gaya.special: Bodh Gaya—place of Buddha’s enlightenment (Mahabodhi Temple, UNESCO site); Vishnupad Temple; International tourism.

Muzaffarpur.special: World-famous Shahi Litchi (GI Tag); Leechi Research Institute.
Muzaffarpur.famous: Jubba Sahni Park, Garib Sthan Mandir.

Darbhanga.special: Known as “Heart of Mithilanchal”; rich Maithili culture; Darbhanga Raj.

Bhagalpur.special: “Silk City of India” (Tussar silk); Vikramshila University ruins; River Ganga; Gangetic dolphin sanctuary.

Madhubani.special: Mithila/Madhubani Painting (world-famous art form, GI Tag); Maithil culture.

Begusarai.special: “Industrial Capital of Bihar”; Barauni Refinery, Thermal Power Station.
Begusarai.famous: Kanwar Lake (Asia’s largest freshwater oxbow lake).

Purnia.special: Gateway to Northeast; major maize producer; known for alluvial soil.

West Champaran.special: Champaran Satyagraha by Gandhi ji (1917); Valmiki Tiger Reserve.

East Champaran (Motihari).special: Starting point of Gandhi’s Champaran Movement.

Vaishali.special: World’s first republic (Lichchhavi); Buddha delivered last sermon here; birthplace of Lord Mahavira.

Rohtas.special: Rohtasgarh Fort; Tomb of Sher Shah Suri.

Buxar.special: Battle of Buxar (1764, decisive for British in India); religious place—Brahmarshi Vishwamitra’s Tapobhumi.

Saran (Chhapra).famous: Sonepur Mela, literary personalities (Dr. Rajendra Prasad).

Gopalganj.special: Birthplace of former CM Lalu Prasad Yadav.

Siwan.special: Home district of Dr. Rajendra Prasad, first President of India.

Munger.special: Ancient gunsmithing; Yoga capital (Bihar School of Yoga); historical fort.

Saharsa.special: Flood-prone, Koshi river basin; Maithili region.

Madhepura.special: “Electric loco factory” by Indian Railways; prone to floods.

Khagaria.special: Flood-prone; meets Ganga, Kosi, Gandak rivers.

Kishanganj.special: Highest Muslim population % in Bihar; “Mini Assam” due to tea gardens.

Sheohar.special: Smallest district by area; carved from Sitamarhi.

Sheikhpura.special: Newest (formed in 1994); known for guava, betel (paan).

Lakhisarai.special: Ancient trade route; historic Ashok Dham.

Jamui.special: Forested; mineral rich (mica); Nagi Dam Bird Sanctuary.

Nawada.special: Home to Kakolat Falls; Buddhist influence (Pawapuri nearby).

Banka.special: Mandar Hill (mythological site, Samudra Manthan); forested.

Kaimur.famous: Mundeshwari Devi Temple (oldest functional temple in India).

Arwal.special: Smallest by population; part of Magadh region.
